name: "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" (2014) Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which character narrated the opening sequences of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Master Splinter.

	The turtle's mentor and father figure, Master Splinter, a mutated rat, narrated the opening sequence of the film. The narration provided the viewers with a lot of exposition and background on this version of the turtle's origin story. For the purpose of this film the four were lab experiments.

questions.text: Early in the movie it was mentioned that a "dark force" was rising in the city. What was that a reference to?
options: The rise of unrelated gang activity in the state of New York
The mutation of creatures across the city
Literally large dark clouds hovering over the city
questions.explanation:
The Foot Clan.

	The Foot Clan has been one of the main villains for the crime fighting turtles in nearly every incarnation across the pop culture spectrum. The turtles have fought the Foot in comic books, television, movies, novels, video games and in live action stage plays. In this film the Foot Clan has twisted from the international ninja organisation to a U.S. based terrorist group. The members in this movie carry guns and can sometimes be seen in full body armor.

questions.text: Who was the leader of the crime organization within the movie?
questions.explanation:
Shredder.

	Tohoru Masamune played the character of Shredder, though it was a late change in the script to have the character he played exist at all. Originally the character of Eric Sacks was going to be revealed as the Shredder. Within the movie the character wears a samurai suit made from a bright and shiny metal. The suit has retractable blades and is much more formidable that the suits shown in several of the previous movies.

questions.text: Prior to mutating, the turtles were both science experiments and April O'Neil's pets.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In various incarnations the turtles have been pets, and lab experiments, but never have they been both prior to this movie. The turtles were often fed pizza and filmed by April while she hung out in the lab where her father performed experiments on the turtles.

questions.text: What national chain of pizza restaurants were featured in the film?
questions.explanation:
Pizza Hut.

	Pizza Hut launched a nationwide advertising campaign in to co-inside with the release of the movie. Due to the marketing agreement Pizza Hut was the only brand of pizza shown in the film. Pizza Hut boxes are shown in nearly scene where the turtles are scarfin' pizza.

questions.text: Where did April O'Neil work at in the beginning of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Channel 6 News.

	In the original 1989 movie, April owned an antique store in addition to working at the news station. In the 2003 television story, April worked as a lab assistant. "The Daily Planet" is a newspaper in the Superman mythos. In this movie, April was only shown to work at the news station. She was a rookie reporter who often got the fluff assignments instead of hard news.

questions.text: What was Mikey's drink of choice while scarfing pizza?
questions.explanation:
Orange Crush soda.

	Coca Cola, the owner of the Crush brand of soda, bought the marketing rights to have their soda in the movie. While Orange Crush was the only brand shown in the movie, Grape, Strawberry and Blueberry Crush sodas were also sold in stores for several months leading up to and after the movie. Each can of the specialty soda had one of the four turtles on it. Mikey was shown drinking the soda in at least two scenes in the film, often while scarfing some pizza in the lair.

Jonathan Liebesman.

	Munroe, Barron and Gillard each directed one of the other movies in the "TMNT" universe. Liebesman also directed "Darkness Falls", "The Killing Room" and "Battle: Los Angeles" prior to helming this movie.

questions.text: What city was the movie primarily set in?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	New York was the setting of the film, though there were also scenes shot in snowy mountain tops that seemingly were within a few minutes driving time of the city. The other three options are each fictional cities within the DC Comics universe.

questions.text: The character designs of each of the four turtles incorporated the stunt actors actual features into the CGI designs.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Instead of making the four suits almost identical like in the previous three live action films, the costume designers incorporated real facial features into each turtle. Each of the turtles also had a distinctive design. Raphael was shorter and stockier than the others, Donatello was thinner and had significantly less muscle mass than his brothers. Leo had battle scars and armor and Mikey wore clothing and appeared more comical than the other turtles.
